alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:27PM EST until February 19 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New York... West Branch Delaware At Walton affecting Delaware County. For the West Branch Delaware River...including Hale Eddy, Walton... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Branch Delaware At Walton. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Fairgrounds begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:16 PM EST Friday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:16 PM EST Friday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
